image.alt: Smiling patients and friendly team at Figueroa Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Thanks for visiting the website of Figueroa Orthodontics. We proudly provide the Naperville and Winnetka, IL communities with friendly, family-oriented orthodontic care. Our team creates a pleasant, relaxed atmosphere and spends extra time with you so every question is answered and your treatment feels comfortable from day one.

You’ll enjoy coming to our practice because we truly care about your experience and your smile. We combine thoughtful, personalized care with modern orthodontic tools to help you achieve predictable, efficient results.

items.title: Advanced Technology

image.alt: iTero digital scanner and CBCT technology

items.text: We use iTero digital impressions and 3D imaging to plan more accurate, comfortable treatment.

items.title: Clear, convenient monitoring

image.alt: Remote Dental Monitoring for clear aligner patients

items.text: Remote Dental Monitoring keeps aligner patients on track between visits, saving time and visits.

items.title: Comfortable braces options

image.alt: Damon Clear braces provide a low‑profile, comfortable option

items.text: We offer modern braces systems, including tie‑less options, to help reduce treatment time and discomfort.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alex Figueroa, DMD, is an experienced orthodontist and partner in the practice. He trained at Case Western Reserve University School of Dental Medicine (DMD) and completed an Orthodontics Specialty Certificate and a Certificate in Temporomandibular Joint Dysfunction at the University of Rochester, Eastman Institute for Oral Health. Dr. Alex enjoys building long-term relationships with patients and creating individualized treatment plans that improve confidence and function.

image.alt: Dr. Alex Figueroa, DMD, orthodontist at Figueroa Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alvaro Figueroa is a senior orthodontist with decades of clinical experience and extensive craniofacial work. He earned an Orthodontics Specialty Certificate at the University of Rochester School of Medicine and Dentistry, and a Pediatric Dentistry Specialty Certificate and Master of Science in Oral Health at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Dr. Alvaro completed fellowships at the Center for Craniofacial Anomalies at UIC and at the National Institute of Dental and Craniofacial Research. He has lectured internationally and participates in humanitarian surgical missions.

image.alt: Dr. Alvaro Figueroa, orthodontist and co-founder of Figueroa Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ahmed Shawky earned his DDS and MS degrees from the University of Minnesota (DDS ’21, BS/MS in Biomedical Engineering) and completed additional orthodontic training, including an MS in Orthodontics at Marquette University (MS ’24) with an Orthodontics Specialty Certificate. He is focused on patient-centered care, clear communication, and modern techniques to deliver efficient, comfortable treatment.

image.alt: Dr. Ahmed Shawky, orthodontist at Figueroa Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: From clear aligners to Damon® braces, we offer modern orthodontic options for children, teens, and adults, backed by digital imaging and personalized treatment planning.

image.alt: Patient holding clear aligners for comfortable orthodontic treatment
Damon Clear braces for a low‑profile aesthetic
Cone beam 3D imaging for advanced orthodontic diagnosis
Early two‑phase treatment to guide growth in children

og_meta.title: Home - Figueroa Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Family-centered orthodontics in Naperville and Winnetka, IL — clear aligners, Damon braces, digital imaging, and individualized care.

image.alt: Bright, modern orthodontic office interior with welcoming reception and treatment rooms

paragraphs.text: Our practice is committed to delivering exceptional, patient-centered orthodontic care. We treat orthodontics as an investment in a patient’s health and self-esteem, offering individualized treatment plans, comfortable modern technology, and flexible financial options so families know what to expect before treatment begins.

We design workflows to respect patients’ time through conveniences like online forms, digital scanning, and virtual monitoring. That combination of efficiency and thoughtful care helps patients stay on track and feel comfortable every step of the way.

We offer a wide range of treatment options, including braces, clear aligners, and specialized craniofacial protocols, to create confident, healthy smiles while matching each plan to the patient’s lifestyle and goals.

Using advanced technology, gentle techniques, and flexible scheduling, we make quality orthodontic care accessible for families in our community, so every patient leaves with improved function, comfort, and confidence.

image.alt: Dr. Alex Figueroa headshot

paragraphs.text: “The best part about being an orthodontist is interacting with our patients and getting to know each one personally,” says Dr. Alex Figueroa. He focuses on building lasting relationships with patients and their families while delivering evidence-based orthodontic care. He is actively involved in craniofacial treatment efforts and contributes to continuing education and research in the field.

image.alt: Dr. Alex Figueroa portrait in treatment room

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alex’s full professional biography is available on his doctor page. His clinical background includes specialty training in orthodontics and ongoing involvement with craniofacial teams and research programs, providing expertise in both routine and complex cases.

image.alt: Dr. Alex Figueroa portrait

paragraphs.text: Outside the office Dr. Alex enjoys spending time with his wife Jessica and sons Eddie and Sammy. He loves exploring Chicago, biking, golfing, and skiing, and he brings that same warm, energetic approach to caring for patients of all ages.

image.alt: Dr. Alex Figueroa smiling
Dr. Alvaro Figueroa headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alvaro Figueroa has practiced orthodontics for decades with a deep commitment to both private practice and craniofacial care. He has travelled and taught internationally through surgical missions and collaborations to expand access to cleft and craniofacial treatment.

image.alt: Dr. Alvaro Figueroa portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alvaro’s training includes an Orthodontics Specialty Certificate from the University of Rochester School of Medicine and Dentistry, pediatric dentistry and a Master of Science from the University of Illinois at Chicago, plus fellowship training in craniofacial programs. He has published extensively in the cleft and craniofacial field.

image.alt: Dr. Alvaro Figueroa portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alvaro enjoys family time with his wife Michele and their sons. He and Michele like tandem biking, golf, tennis, boating, and water skiing. He values long-term relationships with patients, often treating multiple generations of the same family.

image.alt: Dr. Alvaro Figueroa smiling
Dr. Ahmed Shawky headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ahmed Shawky brings a strong clinical and academic background to the team and is involved in contemporary orthodontic practice and patient education. He emphasizes clear patient communication and evidence-based care across routine and specialist treatments.

image.alt: Dr. Ahmed Shawky portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ahmed trained in dentistry and orthodontics with degrees that include a DDS and advanced orthodontic specialty training. His academic background blends dental and biomedical engineering training with orthodontic specialty studies, and he participates in professional organizations to remain current with best practices.

image.alt: Dr. Ahmed Shawky education portrait

paragraphs.text: Away from work Dr. Ahmed enjoys running, cycling, cooking, and socializing with family and friends. He brings an energetic and approachable manner to patient care and values being part of the local community.

image.alt: Dr. Ahmed Shawky smiling

og_meta.title: About Us | Figueroa Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet the doctors and team at Figueroa Orthodontics. We offer modern orthodontic treatments, cleft and craniofacial care, and convenient new-patient tools.

image.alt: Orthodontic practice reception with smiling staff and patient

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Every smile starts with an initial consultation: you will meet our team, learn about orthodontic options, receive a complete initial exam by one of the doctors, and review recommended treatment options. If treatment is recommended, orthodontic records will be taken and a customized treatment presentation with a proposed plan, estimated timeline, and cost will be provided.
Please complete the patient information form before your first appointment; you may submit it online or bring a printed, completed copy to your visit.

Scheduling and appointments: once you choose to proceed, the appliance placement appointment typically takes about an hour. Our team will review care instructions and answer questions so you feel confident moving forward.

COVID and office-safety expectations: please brush and floss prior to your visit. About an hour before your appointment you may receive a text with a link to a Supplemental Consent and Health Questionnaire that must be signed. Arrival procedures may include calling from your car, temperature checks, limiting guests, hand-washing or a hydrogen-peroxide rinse, and additional personal protective equipment used by staff.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation area with patient and staff

paragraphs.text: We will create a payment plan tailored to your needs and review options during your financial consultation. Payment methods accepted include Visa, MasterCard, Discover, cash, and check. Financing options include no-interest office plans and additional financing through CareCredit.

Insurance: our office will submit claims to your carrier on your behalf; most plans cover a portion of orthodontic care, so please bring your dental insurance card so we can verify coverage. Complimentary consultations are available to review treatment options and costs.
Before your appointment please complete your new patient forms. You may submit the secure online forms ahead of time or download and bring a printed PDF to the office.
If you cannot open PDFs, Adobe Reader is available free; bring completed printed forms if you prefer to hand-deliver them.

image.alt: Patient completing new patient forms on a tablet
Family enjoying time together

seo.page_description: Start your orthodontic journey with Figueroa Orthodontics. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access new patient forms, and book a free consultation.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, patient forms, payment, Figueroa Orthodontics, consultation

og_meta.title: Get Started | Figueroa Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with Figueroa Orthodontics. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access new patient forms, and book a free consultation.

image.alt: Smiling patients receiving care at the orthodontic practice

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends a first orthodontic check around age seven. By then a mix of baby and adult teeth helps the orthodontist spot bite and jaw issues early so treatment can be simpler and more effective.

Early treatment can guide jaw growth, adjust the width of the dental arches, create space for crowded teeth, and sometimes avoid future extractions. It can also address habits like thumb sucking and help improve minor speech concerns.

Watch for signs such as early or late loss of baby teeth, trouble chewing or biting, mouth breathing, persistent thumb or finger sucking, crowded or blocked teeth, or jaws that pop. Contact the practice to schedule an early evaluation.

image.alt: Young patient receiving an early orthodontic evaluation in a bright treatment room

paragraphs.text: Orthodontic care is common for adults and can address both health and cosmetic goals. Many adults seek treatment for bite problems, crowded or spaced teeth that raise the risk of decay and gum disease, jaw discomfort, or to finish incomplete treatment from younger years.

Options for adult patients include clear braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, lingual braces that sit behind the teeth, traditional metal braces, and Spark clear aligners. Because jaw growth is complete, some adults may require combined orthodontic and surgical care or periodontal evaluation before or during treatment.

image.alt: Adult patient meeting with the orthodontist to discuss treatment options

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces and ceramic options, including low-profile Damon-style systems, move teeth by applying controlled forces through brackets and archwires. Each appliance type is selected based on the specific tooth movements needed and patient preferences.

Typical treatment after full permanent-teeth eruption averages about 24 months, though individual timelines vary. Records such as models, X-rays, and photos guide appliance selection, estimated duration, and visit frequency. Retainers are provided after braces are removed to stabilize results.
Brackets and wires apply gentle, continuous pressure to guide teeth into planned positions while the bone remodels around them.

image.alt: Close-up of braces on teeth showing brackets and archwire

paragraphs.text: Your orthodontist will map a treatment plan and share a timeline. Many comprehensive cases finish in about two years, with variations depending on complexity and patient compliance.

image.alt: Patient during two-phase treatment with braces being adjusted
Two-phase orthodontic treatment photo showing patients with braces

paragraphs.text: Clear aligner systems such as Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Spark use a series of custom-made plastic trays that are worn and changed on a set schedule, typically every one to two weeks, to move teeth gently and predictably.
Many mild-to-moderate alignment and spacing concerns can be treated with clear aligners. An in-office evaluation with digital scans determines candidacy and creates a 3D treatment plan.

Patients choose clear aligners because they are discreet, removable for eating and oral hygiene, and often more comfortable than brackets. See the practice pages for Spark clear aligners and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> for more details.

image.alt: Clear aligner tray being placed on a patient's teeth

paragraphs.text: Surgical orthodontics is recommended for significant skeletal jaw discrepancies that cannot be corrected with braces or aligners alone. In these cases orthodontic preparation, surgical repositioning of the jaws, and postoperative orthodontic finishing are coordinated to achieve both function and facial balance.

Care is planned as a team effort between the orthodontist and an oral and maxillofacial surgeon, and often involves craniofacial specialists. The practice works with a network of surgical and dental colleagues to manage complex cases.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving a surgical consultation for jaw correction

paragraphs.text: Retainers keep your new smile stable. After active treatment removable retainers help dental and soft tissues settle, and bonded retainers may be recommended in select cases to maintain alignment long term.

We typically recommend full-time retainer wear for the first year after braces are removed, then nightly wear thereafter. Over time many patients maintain results by wearing retainers at least one night per week.

Care for retainers includes avoiding heat, storing them in a protective case, cleaning gently with a toothbrush and mild soap or denture cleaner, and contacting the office right away if a retainer is lost or damaged, as replacements may incur a charge.

image.alt: Orthodontic retainers on a tray with care instructions

paragraphs.text: The practice uses advanced digital tools to improve precision and comfort. Technologies include 3D digital radiography, iTero digital impressions that avoid messy putty, cone-beam CT for complex diagnosis and surgical planning, and Dental Monitoring for remote check-ins between visits.
These tools produce accurate records, speed treatment planning, and allow more predictable appliance fabrication and aligner design, which benefits patients at every stage of care.
Fast, radiation-free scans capture precise 3D images for accurate treatment planning and aligner fabrication.

image.alt: iTero digital scanner being used during an orthodontic consultation

paragraphs.text: Remote monitoring technology lets the team check progress between visits, often reducing the number of in-office appointments.

image.alt: Advanced orthodontic technology in a modern treatment room
Modern orthodontic office showcasing advanced digital equipment
Family enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Contact Figueroa Orthodontics | Naperville & Winnetka
og_meta.description: Contact Figueroa Orthodontics in Naperville or Winnetka. Request an appointment, access new-patient forms, and get directions to our offices.

image.alt: Bright, modern orthodontic office interior with comfortable seating and warm lighting

paragraphs.text: Find clear, practical answers to common questions about treatments, insurance and payments, scheduling, and patient forms for Figueroa Orthodontics in Naperville.

accordion.header: What treatment options do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer a full range of orthodontic care, including Damon System clear braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> Teen, Spark clear aligners, lingual (behind‑the‑tooth) braces, accelerated orthodontics, and custom lingual solutions. We also treat complex cases such as nasoalveolar molding and other craniofacial needs; your treatment plan will be tailored to your goals and anatomy.

image.alt: Close-up of Damon clear braces on a smiling patient

accordion.header: How does insurance and payment work?

paragraphs.text: We submit claims to your insurance carrier on your behalf and will estimate benefits once we have your plan details. Coverage varies by carrier and plan. We accept Visa, MasterCard, Discover, cash, and check, offer in‑office, no‑interest payment plans, and work with CareCredit for additional options. For details on financing and insurance, see our financial information page: https://figueroaorthodontics.com/financial-information/.

accordion.header: How do I schedule, cancel or request an appointment?

paragraphs.text: To request a new appointment complete our online form at https://figueroaorthodontics.com/request-an-appointment/. For new patient intake you can fill the secure online form at https://secureonline.co/new-patient-form-figueroaorthodontics/ or print and bring the PDF: https://figueroaorthodontics.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/2019-Oct-New-FigOrtho-Patient-Info-HIPAA-Forms.pdf. For cancellations or urgent needs call the office directly.

image.alt: Patient filling out an appointment request form on a tablet

accordion.header: What should I expect during treatment and how do I care for appliances?

paragraphs.text: Mild soreness for 3–5 days after placing braces and some lip or cheek irritation for 1–2 weeks is common; we provide orthodontic wax to ease discomfort. Teeth may feel slightly loose during active movement, which is normal. If a wire or band becomes loose, temporarily apply wax or gently tuck the wire back and call for a repair appointment. Follow rubber band and appliance wear instructions closely to keep treatment on track.

Retainer care: keep retainers away from heat, store them in their case (keep them away from pets), clean with a toothbrush and mild soap or denture cleaner, and rinse thoroughly. Fixed retainers should be checked during regular dental visits.

image.alt: Orthodontic tools and braces care materials on a tray

accordion.header: Are virtual or remote appointments available?

paragraphs.text: Yes. We offer Dental Monitoring for patients on clear aligner therapy, which lets you send scans and photos via an app so our doctors can review progress remotely. This service can reduce in‑office visits and there is no extra charge for patients enrolled in Dental Monitoring.

image.alt: Patient using a mobile app for virtual orthodontic monitoring
Family enjoying time together
